alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Stevens; Todd (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 03 at 10:41PM CDT until April 05 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...COMPLEX PROLONGED WINTER STORM TO BRING MULTIPLE PRECIPITATION TYPES AND BLOWING SNOW ACROSS PORTIONS OF WESTERN AND CENTRAL MINNESOTA TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY... .A strengthening weather system will impact the area beginning Tuesday morning in western Minnesota, spreading north and eastwards throughout the day and into Wednesday. Snow will be the initial precipitation type, with snow eventually becoming mixed with sleet, freezing rain, and rain depending on the area. Winds will increase significantly later on Tuesday and into Wednesday, resulting in significant visibility reductions and areas of blowing snow at times, mainly in western Minnesota. Ice accumulations coupled with strengthening winds could also result in falling tree branches or power lines. A Winter Storm Warning remains in effect starting at 6AM for portions of west-central Minnesota where the combination of falling snow, ice, sleet, and winds will produce the greatest overall impacts to travel and infrastructure. A Winter Weather Advisory remains in effect for areas that will see more mixed precipitation and lower overall accumulation, but will still be impacted by the combination of mixed precipitation and winds. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TUESDAY TO 7 PM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting near 45 mph. * WHERE...Douglas, Todd and Stevens Counties. * WHEN...From 6 AM Tuesday to 7 PM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
